bunpro.meaning: Even, To even, To the extent of
bunpro.writeup: Theadverbial particleまでis used in the same way as many other adverbial particles, in that it is highlighting that the statement that comes after it as important in some way. However, unlike our first look atまで, which discussed its use as 'until', this use ofまでhas the nuance of 'even', or 'to the extent'. It can be used after verbs or nouns.Although usingまでas 'even' may seem different to 'until', they are essentially the same thing in Japanese. This is becauseまでalways means '(A)まで, (B)', where (A) is the 'limitation/extent', and (B) is the 'noteworthy factor'. This 'noteworthy factor' will usually be a descriptive word/phrase, such as a verb, adjective, or explanation.Fun FactTheもparticle is sometimes grouped together withまで, when the meaning is 'even'. This just adds emphasis to the fact that the event is somewhat surprising, or that the result is satisfying.

examples.japanese: 私はお金を払ってまで旅行には行きたくない。
examples.english: I would not go to the extent of paying money to go traveling.

examples.japanese: お腹が空きすぎて、大嫌いなバナナまで食べた。
examples.english: Because I was so hungry, I even ate a banana, which I hate.

examples.japanese: バイクまで持っているの?
一回笑ったら、面白くない話までおかしくなる。
examples.english: Once you start laughing, even uninteresting topics become funny.

examples.japanese: 私はスポーツカーまでも持っています。
examples.english: I even have a sports car.

examples.japanese: 夜中まで日本語の文法を勉強している。
examples.english: I'm studying Japanese grammar even in the middle of the night. (to the extent・until)

examples.japanese: お腹が空いているとき、熊は果実まで食べる。
examples.english: Bears will even go as far as to eat berries when they are hungry. (to the extent・until)

examples.japanese: お金を払ってまでテストを受けたくない。
examples.english: I don't want to go to the extent of paying money to take the test.(even...to the extent of・until)

examples.japanese: 頭まで痛くなってきた。
examples.english: Even my head is starting to hurt. (to the extent・until)

examples.japanese: 君たちがいたから、ここまで来られた。
examples.english: Because you guys were here, we were able to come as far as this point. (to this extent・until)

dojg.description: A particle to indicate a spatial, temporal or quantitative limit or an unexpected animate/inanimate object.
dojg.meaning: As far as; till; up to; until; through; even

examples.japanese: (ksa).昨日は三時から五時まで友達とテニスをした・しました。
examples.english: Yesterday I played tennis from three to five with my friend.

examples.japanese: (ksb).東京から京都まで新幹線で三時間かかる・かかります
examples.english: It takes three hours by bullet train from Tokyo to Kyoto.

examples.japanese: (ksc).私が行くまでうちで待っていて下さい。
examples.english: Please wait at home until I get there.

examples.japanese: (ksd).このホールは二千人まで入れる・入れます。
examples.english: This hall can hold up to 2,000 people.

examples.japanese: (kse).あの人は鼠やスカンクは勿論蛇まで好きだ・好きです。
examples.english: He even likes snakes, not to mention rats and skunks.

examples.japanese: (a).アメリカ人は毎週月曜日から金曜日まで働く。
examples.english: Americans work every week from Monday through Friday.

examples.japanese: (b).駅から大学までは歩いて十分ぐらいです。
examples.english: It's about 10 minutes from the station to the university on foot.

examples.japanese: (c).スミスさんは刺身は勿論、納豆まで食べるんですよ。
examples.english: Mr. Smith even eats fermented soybeans, not to mention raw fish.

examples.japanese: (d).飛行機が出るまでロビーで友達と話していた。
examples.english: Until the plane left I was talking with my friend in the lobby.

dojg.writeup: ## 'Xまで' and 'until X' do not have the same meaning when X represents a duration of time. For example, in (1) 来週の月曜日まで means that the speaker will be absent next Monday; therefore, the corresponding English is 'until next Tuesday'.
